tweet: A good one to start 4A boys. Corner Canyon and Payson tied at 43 with 2:03 to play.

Corner Canyon leads Payson 21-20 at halftime in 4A opener at Weber.  Region 8 must be good. Lions are impressive.
Upset? Payson has opened up a 15-9 lead over Corner Canyon with 6:08 left in first half at Weber.
Corner Canyon and Payson tied at 7 after one quarter. Both struggling to score!
Some nerves on both Payson and Corner Canyon. Lions have missed two layups and Chargers whistled for two travel calls. CC leads 2-0.

Props to Sky View fans. Easy to be good winners. But Bobcat fans waiting to greet team. Classy gesture.
Price subs out Layton starters with 16 seconds left. Bassett finishes with 37 points. Layton wins title, 73-65.
Layton's last state girls basketball title came in 2005. Van Price was the coach.
Give Layton credit for never attempting to stall. Lancers stayed aggressive in fourth and it paid off with state title.
Bassett has scored Layton's last 11 points in crunch time. What an effort!
Ball rolls off rim for Sky View. On next play, Bassett shot rolls in. Layton leads 62-53. Bassett has 32.
Bassett has scored six straight points to give Layton a 60-53 lead over Sky View with 2:41 to play.
Hailey Bassett is having an amazing game for Layton. She has been one constant all day. She has 28 points with 3:16 to play.
Borges and Martinez back in for Layton. Both have four fouls.
Both Layton and Sky View are in double bonus early in fourth. Neither seems to be able to make a free throw though.
Layton leads Sky View 50-48 at end of three quarters. This is such an intense game. Hard to believe both teams can keep pace up.
Sky View gets first lead with a minute left in third. Bobcats lead Layton 48-47.
Layton has missed three big free throws. Lancers look a little rattled as Sky View ties game at 45,.
Layton in serious foul trouble late in third. Sunni Martinez just got her fourth foul and is benched. Lancers lead 45-43.
Layton's Livia Borges just picked up her fourth foul. Sky View's pressure defense giving Lancers fits.
Layton-Sky View getting very chippy. Words being exchanged as play getting very physical. Lancers missing some key free throws.
Sky View cuts Layton lead to 41-35. Lancers call time out.
Layton's Borges gets third foul and will get a rest. Lancers lead sky View 41-33.
Layton leads Sky View 35-26 at halftime behind Hailey Bassett's 18 points. Bobcats ended half with 7-3 run to stay within striking distance.
Layton leads 32-22 late in first quarter. Sky View missing a lot of free throws or would be closer.
Sky View on a 6-0 run. Bobcats cut Layton's lead to 31-19.
Layton coach Van Price resting Bassett and Borges. But subs playing well. Lancers extend lead to 26-12.
Layton has a 22-12 lead after one quarter against Sky View. Physical games, but teams are having trouble converting free throws. Nerves?
Layton owns a 17-9 lead over Sky View with three minutes left in first quarter. Hailey Bassett has 10 points already.
Hailey Bassett has scored the first six points of the game to give Layton an early 6-0 lead before a large and loud crowd.
The Class 5A girls championship game is underway at SLCC with unbeaten Layton battling Sky View,
